page.title: 07HEALTH
page.content: There are eight dentists in Dunstable. We visited one of them. You have to work very hard and pass a minimum of 7"O" levels and 3 "A" levels before you can start training. In our town there seems to be more people with decayed teeth than healthy teeth. The Dunstable dentists haveto work very hard and on average in a small dentist you would get about forty five to fifty people a day .Usually you have to be 22 to be a dentist and be 60 - 65 to retire. The average child in Dunstable has three fillings. In the dentists surgery there are lots of tools such as the probe used for exploring round teeth, the mirror is used to see upper teeth, the packer to pack fillings in firmly and the electric drill used to drill into the decay to the tooth. More children need braces to correct teeth.
